intro: Urtica alienata, commonly known as the stinging nettle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its hollow,螫刺 (stinging) stems and heart-shaped leaves covered in fine, irritating hairs. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Urtica alienata is often found in disturbed areas such as fields, woodland edges, and along roadsides. Its leaves and stems are used in traditional medicine and as a food source when properly prepared.
